title: Pitchfork Configuration
description:
Configuration schema for pitchfork.toml daemon supervisor configuration files.

Note: When read from a file, daemon keys are short names (e.g., "api").
After merging, keys become qualified DaemonIds (e.g., "project/api").

daemons.description: Map of daemon IDs to their configurations

oneOf.description: Retrigger only if the previous run has finished (success or error)
Always retrigger, stopping the previous run if still active
Retrigger only if the previous run succeeded
Retrigger only if the previous run failed

PitchforkTomlAuto.description: Automatic behavior triggered by shell hooks

oneOf.description: Automatically start when entering the directory
Automatically stop when leaving the directory

retrigger.description: Behavior when cron triggers while previous run is still active

schedule.description: Cron expression (e.g., '0 * * * *' for hourly, '*/5 * * * *' for every 5 minutes)

PitchforkTomlDaemon.description: Configuration for a single daemon (internal representation with DaemonId)

auto.description: Automatic start/stop behavior based on shell hooks

boot_start.description: Whether to start this daemon automatically on system boot

cron.description: Cron scheduling configuration for periodic execution

depends.description: List of daemon IDs that must be started before this one

dir.description: Working directory for the daemon. Relative paths are resolved from the pitchfork.toml location.

env.description: Environment variables to set for the daemon process

on_cron_trigger.description: Command to run when cron triggers (before starting the daemon)

on_fail.description: Command to run when the daemon fails (exits with non-zero code)

on_ready.description: Command to run when the daemon passes its ready check

on_retry.description: Command to run before each retry attempt

ready_cmd.description: Shell command to poll for readiness (exit code 0 = ready)

ready_delay.description: Delay in milliseconds before considering the daemon ready

ready_http.description: HTTP URL to poll for readiness (expects 2xx response)

ready_output.description: Regex pattern to match in stdout/stderr to determine readiness

ready_port.description: TCP port to check for readiness (connection success = ready)

retry.description:
Number of times to retry if the daemon fails.
Can be a number (e.g., `3`) or `true` for infinite retries.

run.description: The command to run. Prepend with 'exec' to avoid shell process overhead.

watch.description: File patterns to watch for changes

Retry.description:
Retry configuration that accepts either a boolean or a count.
- `true` means retry indefinitely (u32::MAX)
- `false` or `0` means no retries
- A number means retry that many times
